input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row.

indir.description: The directory where the input images are located (or where they will be cached once they are downloaded). If undefined, it defaults to <outdir>/input

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

data_options.title: Data Ingestion
data_options.description: Describe your input data that lives in the `input` directory

channels.description: List of channel names to process.
channels.help_text: Channel names are specified in the format "c[channel_number]", where the channel_number is 0-indexed.

resolution.description: Voxel resolution in all 3 dimensions. Default: 0.23,0.23,0.42
resolution.help_text: This is a comma-delimited tuple as x,y,z.

stitching_channel.description: Name of the channel used for stitching, e.g. 'c1' or '1'. You can also specify 'all' to use all of the channels. Default: 'all'

flatfield_correction.description: Apply flatfield correction before stitching? Default: false

darkfieldfile.description: Path to the precomputed darkfield file used for flatfield correction?

flatfieldfile.description: Path to the precomputed flatfield file used for flatfield correction

axis_mapping.description: Axis mapping for the objective->pixel coordinates conversion. Default: -x,y,z
axis_mapping.help_text: Comma-separated axis specification with optional flips.

stitching_block_size.description: Block size to use when converting input data to n5 before stitching. Default: 128,128,64

final_block_size_xy.description: Block size (in Z dimension) when retiling after stitching. Default: 64
final_block_size_xy.help_text: This must be smaller than the number of Z slices in the data.

stitching_padding.description: Padding for the overlap regions. Default: 0,0,0

stitching_blur_sigma.description: Sigma value of the gaussian blur pre-applied to the images before stitching. Default: 2

spark_cluster.description: Use a distributed cluster to run Spark jobs? Default: false
spark_cluster.help: By default, the Spark jobs will execute in a standalone Spark instance running as a single job. If you enable this option, a transient Spark cluster will be created on multiple nodes (controlled by the options below).

spark_workers.description: Number of Spark workers to use for stitching one acquisition. Default: 10

min_spark_workers.description: Minimum number of Spark workers needed to start stitching pipeline. Default: 5

spark_worker_cores.description: Number of cores allocated to each Spark worker. Default: 4

spark_gb_per_core.description: Size of memory (in GB) that is allocated for each core of a Spark worker. Default: 4
spark_gb_per_core.help_text: The total memory usage for stitching one acquisition will be workers * worker_cores * gb_per_core.

spark_driver_cores.description: Number of cores allocated for the Spark driver. Default: 1

spark_driver_mem_gb.description: Amount of memory to allocate for the Spark driver. Default: 12g

spark_local_dir.description: Temporary local folder for Spark processing. Must exist on all cluster nodes. Default: /tmp/spark-${workflow.sessionId}

bigstream_config.description: Location of the YAML bigstream configuration

skip_registration.description: If true skip the entire registration, i.e., global alignment, local alignment, deformations and inverse

skip_local_align.description: If true skip local blockwise alignment

skip_inverse.description: If true skip computing the inverse transformation

registration_fix_id.description: ID of the fix image used for registration

fix_global_subpath.description: Explicit fix image dataset used for global registration

mov_global_subpath.description: Explicit moving image dataset used for global registration

reuse_global_affine.description: If True and global affine exists, reuse it

global_steps.description: Global steps - if not set they are read from the bigstream config

fix_local_subpath.description: Fix dataset used for local registration

mov_local_subpath.description: Moving dataset used for local registration

global_fix_mask.description: Mask used for the global fix image

global_fix_mask_subpath.description: Subpath of the global fix mask

global_mov_mask.description: Mask used for the global moving image

global_mov_mask_subpath.description: Subpath of the global moving mask

local_fix_mask.description: Mask used for the local fix image

local_fix_mask_subpath.description: Subpath of the local fix mask

local_mov_mask.description: Mask used for the local moving image

local_mov_mask_subpath.description: Subpath of the local moving mask

local_inverse_cpus.description: Number of cpus used for the main compute inverse process

local_inverse_mem_gb.description: Memory used by the main compute inverse process

local_deform_cpus.description: Number of cpus used for local deform driver

local_deform_mem_gb.description: Max memory in GB allowed for local deform driver

local_steps.description: Steps for local alignment - if not set they are read from bigstream config yaml

deform_subpath.description: subpath used for saving the deformation field

local_transform_name.description: Name of the container for the local deform transformation

local_inv_transform_name.description: Name of the container for the local inverse deform transformation

with_dask_cluster.description: If true use a distributed dask cluster

warped_scales.description: All scales that need to be warped

global_align_cpus.description: Number of CPUs used for global registration

local_align_cpus.description: CPUs used for local alignment driver

local_align_mem_gb.description: Memory (GB) used for local alignment driver

local_align_workers.description: Number of workers used for local alignment

local_align_min_workers.description: Minimum number of workers that need to be available before the local alignment starts

local_align_worker_cpus.description: Number of CPUs for each worker

bigstream_local_overlap_factor.description: Block overlap used for local alignment

bigstream_inv_step.description: Step used for generating inverse displacement vector

bigstream_inv_iterations.description: Iterations for generating the inverse deformation field. This can be a comma separated list for using multiple iteration levels.

bigstream_inv_shrink_spacings.description: Comma separated list of shrink spacing values per level. The number of values here must equal the number of iteration levels defined by `bigstream_inv_iterations`.

bigstream_inv_smooth_sigmas.description: Comma separated list of smooth sigmas per level

bigstream_inv_step_cut_factor.description: Step cut factor used for generated inverse displacement vector

bigstream_inv_pad.description: Padding used for generated inverse displacement vector

bigstream_inv_use_root.description: Use root for generating the inverse displacement vector

bigstream_dashboard_port.description: Bigstream dask dashboard port - if 0 the scheduler will pick a port that is available. The typical port used by the dask dashboard is 8787

bigstream_scheduler_port.description: Bigstream dask scheduler port - if 0 the scheduler will pick a port that is available. The typical port for the dask scheduler is 8786

global_registration_container.description: Name of the global registration container

local_registration_container.description: Name of the final registration container

spot_channels.description: Comma delimited list of spot channels. This together with spot_scales is used for determining the datasets used for spot extraction.

spot_scales.description: image scale used for spot extraction. This together with spot_channels is used for determining the datasets used for spot extraction.

spot_subpaths.description: alternative for defining the datasets used for spot extraction. If this is defined it takes priority over spot_channels and spot_scales.

rsfish_min_intensity.description: Minimal intensity of the image. Default: 0

rsfish_max_intensity.description: Maximal intensity of the image. Default: 4096

rsfish_anisotropy.help_text: Scaling of z relative to xy. Can be determined using the RS-FISH anisotropy plugin in Fiji.

rsfish_sigma.description: Sigma value for Difference-of-Gaussian (DoG) calculation. Default 1.5

rsfish_threshold.description: Threshold value for Difference-of-Gaussian (DoG) calculation. Default: 0.007

rsfish_background.description: Background subtraction method, 0 == None, 1 == Mean, 2==Median, 3==RANSAC on Mean, 4==RANSAC on Median. Default: 0 (None)

rsfish_intensity.description: Intensity calculation method, 0 == Linear Interpolation, 1 == Gaussian fit (on inlier pixels), 2 == Integrate spot intensities (on candidate pixels). Default: 0 (Linear Interpolation)

rsfish_spark_workers.description: Number of Spark workers to use for spot extraction.

rsfish_min_spark_workers.description: Minimum number of Spark workers needed to start spot extraction pipeline.

rsfish_spark_worker_cores.description: Number of cores allocated to each Spark worker.

rsfish_spark_gb_per_core.description: Size of memory (in GB) that is allocated for each core of a Spark worker.
rsfish_spark_gb_per_core.help_text: The total memory usage for extracting spots from one acquisition will be workers * worker_cores * gb_per_core.

rsfish_spark_driver_cores.description: Number of cores allocated for the Spark driver. Default: 1

rsfish_spark_driver_mem_gb.description: Amount of memory to allocate for the Spark driver. Default: 12g

spots_features.title: Spots stats and characteristics
spots_features.description: Various spots characteristcs, such as counts, area, intensity

spots_counts_subdir.description: data sub-directory used for spots counts

spots_props_subdir.description: data sub-directory used for spots properties

dapi_channel.help_text: The DAPI channel is used as a reference channel for registration, segmentation, and spot extraction.

bleed_channel.description: Channel (other than DAPI) that needs bleedthrough correction.

spots_counts_cores.description: Number of cores needed for getting spots counts.

spots_counts_mem_gb.description: Amount of memory needed for getting spots counts

spots_props_cores.description: Number of cores needed for getting spots properties (intensity).

spots_props_mem_gb.description: Amount of memory needed for getting spots properties (intensity)

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

lsf_queue_size.description: Nextflow queue when submitting tasks to LSF

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

multiscale_with_spark_cluster.description: Use a spark cluster for multiscale

multiscale_min_spark_workers.description: Minimum number of spark workers for multiscale

multiscale_spark_workers.description: Number of spark workers for multiscale

multiscale_spark_worker_cores.description: Number of cores for the multiscale spark workers

multiscale_spark_driver_cores.description: Number of cpus for the multiscale driver

multiscale_spark_driver_mem_gb.description: Max memory allocated for the multi-scale spark driver

segmentation_input.description: Segmentation input image - if set this will be the segmentation input

segmentation_subpaths.description: Comma delimited list of segmentation datasets

segmentation_subdir.description: Relative path of the segmentation result

distributed_cellpose.description: Use a distributed dask cluster to run segmentation

cellpose_dask_config.description: Dask configuration used for distributed cellpose

distributed_cellpose_blocksize.description: Cellpose blocksize used for parallelizing the distributed segmentation

cellpose_blocks_overlap.description: Blocks overlap used for distributed segmentation

cellpose_device.description: GPU device used for cellpose segmentation

cellpose_test.description: Flag used to ouput intermediate segmentation results before inter-block label merging process

cellpose_eval_channels.description: Cellpose eval channels - <cytoplasm channel>,<nucleus channel>. Channel values are typically for grayscale=0, Red=1, Green=2, Blue=3. If the nucleus channel does not exist - set it to 0

cellpose_min_size.description: Minimum number of pixels per mask, can turn off with -1

cellprob_threshold.description: Probabilty threshold to control cellpose mask size.

cellpose_iou_threshold.description: Intersection over union threshold for merging labels from adjacent blocks

cellpose_labels_distance_th.description: Across labels distance transform threshold for merging labels from adjacent blocks

cellpose_save_intermediate_labels.description: If set persist the intermediate labeled blocks - before merging the labels for adjacent blocks

cellpose_merge_with_iou_only.description: Control the merging algorithm for neighboring regions from adjacent blocks. If true use only IOU of the labels across adjacent faces.

cellpose_eval_with_model_only.description: If true segment only with CellposeModel otherwise use both CellposeModel and SizeModel to segment the volume

cellpose_merge_iou_depth.description: Parameter that controls the depth considered for merging the neighboring regions of the adjacent blocks

cellpose_segmentation_cpus.description: Number of CPUs allocated for the segmentation driver

cellpose_segmentation_mem_gb.description: Max memory allocated for the segmentation driver

cellpose_dask_min_workers.description: Minimum number of Dask workers required for segmentation

cellpose_dask_worker_cpus.description: CPUs allocated for a cellpose Dask worker

cellpose_dask_worker_mem_gb.description: Memory allocated for a cellpose Dask worker

cellpose_scheduler_port.description: Default scheduler's port of the Dask segmentation cluster

cellpose_dashboard_port.description: Default dashboards port of the Dask segmentation cluster

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

validationShowHiddenParams.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.

validationFailUnrecognisedParams.description: Validation of parameters fails when an unrecognised parameter is found.
validationFailUnrecognisedParams.help_text: By default, when an unrecognised parameter is found, it returns a warinig.

validationLenientMode.description: Validation of parameters in lenient more.
validationLenientMode.help_text: Allows string values that are parseable as numbers or booleans. For further information see [JSONSchema docs](https://github.com/everit-org/json-schema#lenient-mode).
